intro: Macleania pentaptera, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a flowering plant in the family Malvaceae, native to the tropical regions of the Americas. The plant is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Macleania pentaptera is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions due to its rapid growth and ability to outcompete native vegetation.
